disclaimer.title: Disclaimer
disclaimer.text: This platform is provided 'as is' for research and conservation purposes. While we strive for accuracy, we make no warranties about the completeness, reliability, and accuracy of this information. Any action you take upon the information on this website is strictly at your own risk. We will not be liable for any losses and damages in connection with the use of our platform.

monitoring.description: Generate high-resolution deforestation alerts and track land use changes over time

satellite.title: High-Resolution Satellite Imagery

landing.motivation: While global deforestation monitoring initiatives are invaluable, they often face challenges at local scales where most on-the-ground conservation work happens. Choco Forest Watch bridges this gap by enabling custom machine learning models trained with local expertise.
landing.subtitle: Free, open-source platform supporting local conservation efforts

login.subtitle: Monitor and analyze forest cover changes using satellite imagery and machine learning
login.title: Choco Forest Watch

resetPassword.success: Password reset instructions sent to your email

notifications.aoiSaved: AOI saved successfully. You can now start training your model.

aoi.description: Please draw the Area of Interest (AOI) for your project on the map or upload a GeoJSON file or .zipped Shapefile.

notifications.noFeatures: No valid features found in the file
notifications.tooLarge: AOI is too large. Maximum allowed area is {max} ha
notifications.unsupportedFile: Unsupported file type. Please upload a GeoJSON or a Zipped Shapefile.
notifications.outsideEcuador: The AOI must be within Ecuador's boundaries

aoi.sizeWarning: Warning: AOI size exceeds the maximum allowed ({max} ha)
aoi.title: Define Area of Interest

tooltips.draw: Draw a rectangular AOI on the map
tooltips.upload_aoi: Upload a GeoJSON or zipped Shapefile containing your AOI boundary
tooltips.clear: Remove the current AOI from the map
tooltips.save: Save the current AOI to your project

aoi.explanation: The Area of Interest (AOI) defines the region where deforestation alerts will be generated and statistics will be calculated. This could be the boundaries of a protected area or a larger region that includes a buffer zone around the area you want to monitor. Note that once an AOI is saved, it cannot be modified later.
aoi.limits: Note: During the testing phase, the maximum AOI size is limited to 10,000 hectares and must be within Ecuador. You will receive an error message if these limits are exceeded.

projects.created: Project created successfully. Please define your Area of Interest.

delete.confirm: Are you sure you want to delete the project "{name}"?
delete.title: Confirm Delete

projects.nameRequired: Project name is required. Please enter a name for your project.

tooltips.createNewSection: Start here to create a new project for monitoring deforestation in your area of interest
tooltips.existingSection: View and manage your previously created projects

interpretation.accuracy: The model achieves an overall accuracy of {accuracy}%, meaning it correctly classifies this percentage of all test samples.

classMetrics.precision: Precision: {value}% of areas predicted as {class} are correct
classMetrics.recall: Recall: {value}% of actual {class} areas are correctly identified

interpretation.title: Interpretation

colsample.description: Fraction of features used for building each tree. Can help in reducing overfitting.
colsample.title: Colsample Bytree

estimators.description: The number of trees in the forest. Higher values generally improve performance but increase training time.
estimators.title: Number of Estimators

gamma.description: Minimum loss reduction required to make a further partition. Higher values make the model more conservative.
gamma.title: Gamma

learningRate.description: Step size shrinkage used to prevent overfitting. Lower values are generally better but require more iterations.
learningRate.title: Learning Rate

maxDepth.description: Maximum depth of the trees. Higher values make the model more complex and prone to overfitting.
maxDepth.title: Max Depth

minChildWeight.description: Minimum sum of instance weight needed in a child. Higher values make the model more conservative.
minChildWeight.title: Min Child Weight

subsample.description: Fraction of samples used for fitting the trees. Lower values can help prevent overfitting.
subsample.title: Subsample

sieveFilter.description: Minimum size of connected pixel groups to keep in the final prediction. Higher values create a more generalized map by removing small isolated patches. Set to 0 to disable filtering.
sieveFilter.title: Sieve Filter Size:

splitMethod.featureDescription: Feature-based split ensures independence between training and testing data by splitting entire polygons. Pixel-based split may mix pixels from the same polygon in both training and testing sets.
splitMethod.title: Choose split method:

trainTest.description: This determines the proportion of data used for testing. A value of {value} means {percent}% of the data will be used for testing and {remaining}% for training. Higher test percentages provide more reliable accuracy estimates but leave less data for training, which may lead to overfitting.
trainTest.title: Adjust the train/test split:

validation.invalidConfig: Please ensure all model parameters are valid before training
validation.oneFeature: Classes with exactly 1 feature are not allowed
validation.oneFeatureCaption: Please add at least one more feature to: {classes}

parameterErrors.colsample: Colsample bytree must be between 0 and 1
parameterErrors.estimators: Number of estimators must be at least 10
parameterErrors.learningRate: Learning rate must be greater than 0
parameterErrors.maxDepth: Max depth must be at least 1
parameterErrors.minChildWeight: Min child weight must be at least 1

validation.twoClasses: At least two classes must have training data
validation.twoClassesCaption: Please add features to at least one more class

analysis.intro: Analyze deforestation patterns and verify changes in your area of interest:

review.description: Examine potential deforestation hotspots identified by the model.
review.title: Review Hotspots

run.description: Generate predictions and compare land cover changes between two dates.
run.title: Run Analysis

analysis.title: Welcome to Analysis

verify.description: Confirm or reject detected changes and export your findings.
verify.title: Verify Changes

analysis.description: Get deforestation statistics and set up alerts
analysis.title: Generate Analysis

aoi.description: Draw or upload the boundary of your study area
aoi.title: Define Area of Interest

configure.description: Set up land cover classes and other project-specific settings.
configure.title: Configure Settings

create.description: Start by creating a new project to organize your work
create.title: Create a Project

projects.feedback: We value your input! Please use the feedback button in the navigation bar to send bug reports, suggestions, or general feedback. You can also email directly to: lukebrowne - at - fcat-ecuador.org
projects.intro: Projects help you organize your deforestation monitoring work. Here's how to get started:
projects.landcover: Currently, the system uses 5 fixed land cover classes: forest, non-forest (agriculture), shadow, cloud, and water. Support for custom land cover classes is planned for future updates.
projects.title: Welcome to Choco Forest Watch

train.description: Use our interactive tools to train a land classification model
train.title: Train Your Model

projects.workflow: The workflow is simple: First, create a project and define your area of interest. Then you'll train your own land classification model using our interactive tools. Finally, you'll be able to generate statistics and receive alerts about deforestation in your area.

configure.description: Choose model parameters and validation settings to optimize performance.
configure.title: Configure Model Settings

draw.description: Draw or upload training polygons to identify forest, non-forest, and other land cover types.
draw.title: Draw Training Data

training.intro: Train your own deforestation detection model using machine learning. Follow these steps:
training.title: Welcome to Model Training

train.description: Start training and monitor progress. Review accuracy metrics when complete.
train.title: Train and Evaluate
